```

=== Trajectory Analysis ===

Patient trajectory summary:
  Patients analyzed: 158 
  Mean scores per patient: 4.11 
```


:::
:::



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](intervention_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Individual patient score trajectories (gray lines) and locally weighted regression curves (LOESS, red line with 95% confidence interval in gray shading) are shown for the first 75 days post-transplant, stratified by primary clinical outcome. The risk score incorporates clinical and laboratory parameters to quantify CRE infection risk. Censored patients (n=X) had incomplete follow-up without reaching a definitive endpoint. CRE infection (n=X) includes all patients who developed carbapenem-resistant Enterobacteriaceae infections during follow-up. Death (n=X) represents all-cause mortality. Discharge (n=X) indicates successful hospital discharge without CRE infection or death. Score trajectories demonstrate distinct patterns: discharged patients show early peak and resolution, deaths show progressive elevation, CRE infections display high variability, and censored patients maintain persistently elevated scores.




::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![Maximum Score Distribution by CRE Infection Status](intervention_files/figure-html/fig-score-distribution-boxplot-1.png){#fig-score-distribution-boxplot width=768}
:::
:::

```

=== Statistical Analysis ===
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

T-test for maximum score difference:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Mean score (No CRE): 17.11 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Mean score (CRE): 31.34 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Difference: 14.22 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  p-value: 2.0183e-05 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Wilcoxon rank-sum test:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  p-value: 5.6508e-06 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Logistic Regression Results:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
glm(formula = cre_infection ~ max_score, family = binomial(), 
    data = score_cre_analysis)

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
(Intercept) -1.89910    0.32374  -5.866 4.46e-09 ***
max_score    0.04854    0.01110   4.371 1.23e-05 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1)

    Null deviance: 197.24  on 157  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 174.60  on 156  degrees of freedom
AIC: 178.6

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Odds Ratio per unit increase in max score: 1.05 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
95% CI: 1.028 - 1.074 
```


:::
:::



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Score Summary by CRE Status:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

  <fct>          <int>         <dbl>       <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>           <dbl>
1 No CRE Infect…   108          7.64        11.6     17.1   14.1             6.7
2 CRE Infection     50         12.1         12.7     31.3   19.9            16.5
# ℹ 1 more variable: trajectory_sd <dbl>
```

```
=== Overall Treatment Effect (score_impact___2) ===
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 9
  received_score_based_therapy     n n_infections infection_rate mean_max_score
                         <dbl> <int>        <int>          <dbl>          <dbl>
1                            0   122           28          0.230           16.6
2                            1    36           22          0.611           38.8
# ℹ 4 more variables: sd_score <dbl>, therapy_label <chr>, ci_lower <dbl>,
#   ci_upper <dbl>
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Statistical Tests:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Fisher's exact test p-value: 3.2718e-05 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Odds ratio: 5.209 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

=== Treatment Effectiveness Metrics ===
Infection rate WITHOUT score-based therapy: 23 %
Infection rate WITH score-based therapy: 61.1 %
Absolute Risk Reduction (ARR): -38.16 %
Relative Risk Reduction (RRR): -166.27 %

✗ Score-based therapy appears HARMFUL (paradox - likely confounding)
  Note: High-risk patients more likely to receive therapy
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}

```
THERAPY EFFECTIVENESS SUMMARY
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
============================================
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

1. KEY FINDING:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   ✗ Paradox detected: Therapy group has HIGHER infection rate
   - Likely due to confounding by indication
   - High-risk patients → Get therapy AND get infected
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

2. CLINICAL INTERPRETATION:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   - Score successfully identifies high-risk patients
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   - These patients appropriately receive therapy
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   - True effectiveness requires risk adjustment or RCT
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

3. RECOMMENDATIONS:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   - Review therapy effectiveness
   - Consider alternative interventions
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}


```
# A tibble: 2 × 9
  had_score_based_diagnostic     n n_infections infection_rate mean_max_score
                       <dbl> <int>        <int>          <dbl>          <dbl>
1                          0   127           30          0.236           19.2
2                          1    31           20          0.645           31.8
# ℹ 4 more variables: sd_score <dbl>, diagnostic_label <chr>, ci_lower <dbl>,

```


:::

```

=== Diagnostic Test Impact Metrics ===
Infection rate WITHOUT diagnostic test: 23.6 %
Infection rate WITH diagnostic test: 64.5 %
Absolute Risk Difference: -40.89 %
Relative Risk Reduction: -173.12 %

✗ Diagnostic testing associated with HIGHER infection rates
  Note: Likely confounding - sicker patients get more testing
```

```
=== Interaction Between Diagnostic Tests and Therapy ===
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Intervention Combinations:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 4 × 5
  intervention_group     n n_infections infection_rate mean_score
  <chr>              <int>        <int>          <dbl>      <dbl>
1 Both                  13            7          0.538       43.5
2 Diagnostic Only       18           13          0.722       23.3
3 Neither              104           15          0.144       15.4
4 Therapy Only          23           15          0.652       36.1
```


:::
:::


::: callout-note
The scoring system is working to identify risk, but we cannot determine therapy effectiveness from these observational data due to confounding by indication that persists. I could try more propensity score matching but I am not convinced this will resolved the issue. It is surprising:

-   Only 6.6% of patients had therapy changes with the score

-   Only 6.4% had diagnostic changes with the score
:::


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

